medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the morning of presentation, with increasing pain related to her ventral hernia reported several weeks ago. This morning, after eating breakfast (1.5 bananas), she experienced sharp epigastric pain radiating to her back, associated with nausea and dry heaves. The hernia was initially not reducible but subsequently reported as feeling reduced.
medical_history.past_medical_history: NASH cirrhosis, insulin-dependent diabetes (type II), morbid obesity, bipolar disorder, colon adenoma, compression fractures, depression, diverticulitis, heart murmur, hypertension, hypertriglyceridemia, hypothyroidism, lupus, obesity, sleep apnea, cirrhosis, back pain, carcinoid tumor, arthritis, shoulder dislocation.
medical_history.family_history: Daughter and father with depression; father had two courses of ECT with significant improvement of symptoms despite cognitive impairment.
